intro: Hieracium subpitense, commonly known as the subpitense hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow daisy-like flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Native to Europe, it thrives in grassy areas and disturbed soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and produces small, dark seeds. It is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
